summary: Donald A Purdy, Jr. was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Purdy's name, position, and salary for various accounting periods between November 1977 and November 1978. The documents do not specify Purdy's exact role within the HSCA, but his presence on these payroll and certification reports indicates he was a staff member during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination.
